Detailed Description

This class represents the root mean squared error objective functional of a multilayer perceptron. This objective functional is used in data modeling problems.

See also:
MultilayerPerceptron.

InputTargetDataSet.

Definition at line 32 of file RootMeanSquaredError.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Flood::RootMeanSquaredError::RootMeanSquaredError ( MultilayerPerceptron *  newMultilayerPerceptron,
InputTargetDataSet *  newInputTargetDataSet 
)

General constructor. It creates a root mean squared error objective functional object associated to a multilayer perceptron and measured on an input-target data set. It also initializes all the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Number of evaluations = 0.
  • Epsilon: 1.0e-6.
  • Display = true.

Parameters:
newMultilayerPerceptron Pointer to a multilayer perceptron object.
newInputTargetDataSet Pointer to an input-target data set object.

Definition at line 41 of file RootMeanSquaredError.cpp.

References inputTargetDataSet.

Flood::RootMeanSquaredError::RootMeanSquaredError ( void   ) 

Default constructor. It creates a root mean squared error objective functional object not associated to any multilayer perceptron and not measured on any input-target data set. It also initializes all the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Number of evaluations = 0.
  • Epsilon: 1.0e-6.
  • Display = true.

double Flood::RootMeanSquaredError::calculateEvaluation ( void   )  [virtual]

This method returns the evaluation value of a multilayer perceptron according to the root mean squared error on an input-target data set.

See also:
calculateGradient(void).

Vector< double > Flood::RootMeanSquaredError::calculateGradient ( void   )  [virtual]

This method returns the the root mean squared error function gradient of a multilayer perceptron on an input-target data set. It uses the error back-propagation method.

See also:
calculateEvaluation(void).

Reimplemented from Flood::ObjectiveFunctional.

void Flood::RootMeanSquaredError::saveInputTargetAndOutput ( char *  filename  ) 

This method saves to a file the inputs and the targets in the input-target data set, together with the outputs from the multilayer perceptron for that inputs:

  • Inputs.
  • Targets.
  • Outputs.
